location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.166 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosures relate to the shipwrecking of a vessel carrying pilgrims off the coast of Oman near Ra’s al Ḥadd, its reported plunder of its possession by Bedouins, and several members of its crew murdered. Anderson encloses a copy of letter no.160 of 1856 (folio 133) from Brigadier William Coghlan, Acting Political Resident and Commandant at Aden, dated 21 December 1855. Coghlan’s letter encloses a second Appearance and Deposition (folios 134-36) from a Mahomed Saleh, nakhuda of the vessel Fatteh-el-Khair(this name being different from that stated in Coghlan’s earlier deposition (folios 131-32), which Coghlan believes to be a more accurate description of the incident.
